findings.title: Database credentials are hardcoded in the connection string, making it impossible to rotate passwords without code changes
findings.explanation: Database credentials are hardcoded in the connection string, making it impossible to rotate passwords without code changes. These credentials are visible in version control history.
findings.fix:
const dbUrl = process.env.DATABASE_URL;
// Add to .env: DATABASE_URL=postgresql://...

findings.snippet: const query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = " + userId;
findings.title: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks
findings.explanation: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. User input should be parameterized to prevent malicious queries.
findings.fix: db.query("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1", [userId])

findings.snippet: const query = `SELECT * FROM users WHERE username='${username}' AND password='${password}'`;
findings.title: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks
findings.explanation: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. User input should be parameterized to prevent malicious queries.
findings.fix: db.query("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1", [userId])

findings.snippet: const sql = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE name LIKE '%" + searchTerm + "%'";
findings.title: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks
findings.explanation: This query uses string concatenation to build SQL, making it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. User input should be parameterized to prevent malicious queries.
findings.fix: db.query("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1", [userId])
